articles.title: Chinese premier visits Wuhan, epicentre of coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Li Keqiang inspects efforts to control spread of deadly virus and promises reinforcements as death toll rises to 81.
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Li Keqiang has visited Wuhan to "inspect and direct" efforts to control a deadly virus outbreak and promised reinforcements, as provincial authorities face accusations of not responding in time.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China coronavirus: All you need to know in 500 words
articles.description: A new virus has killed 81 people in China and infected almost 3,000 people, with cases confirmed in several countries.
articles.content:
Health authorities around the world are grappling with an outbreak of a new coronavirus, which originated in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
At least 81 people have died in China and almost 3,000 have been infected worldwide.

articles.author: Peng Peng
articles.title: In Hubei, a family face an unexpected quarantine
articles.description: Al Jazeera's Beijing cameraman went home to Hubei with his family to celebrate Lunar New Year and have no idea when they will be able to return.
articles.content:
Yangxin, Hubei - I thought it would be the usual once-a-year happy journey home for my family when we boarded the highspeed train to go to my hometown, Wuhan, on January 20.

articles.title: China battles coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: The virus thought to have originated in a Wuhan food market continues to spread as China steps up containment efforts.

articles.title: China virus toll spikes to 80, more than 2,700 cases confirmed
articles.description: Country has imposed drastic travel restrictions and extended holiday season to try and curb spread of the virus.
articles.content:
